Key Match Events: Jón Dagur Þorsteinsson scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute
England only managed a single shot on target against Iceland
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate expressed that the result was 'good' for the team despite the poor performance
Former England defender Matthew Upson criticized the team's performance as 'dismal' and 'disjointed'
Post-Match Reflections: Wayne Rooney and Joe Cole were more positive, emphasizing the need for experience and learning from the game
Gareth Southgate acknowledged the team needs to improve without the ball and learn from the experience
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harry Kane missed a golden chance in the 28th minute when he shinned Cole Palmer's cross over from six yards out
Stones was replaced at half-time after appearing to roll his ankle in the first minute
